chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall a : Z, prime a \/ ~ prime a

Premises:
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
Inductive prime (p : Z) : Prop := prime_intro : 1 < p -> (forall n : Z, 1 <= n < p -> rel_prime n p) -> prime p Arguments prime _%Z_scope Arguments prime_intro _%Z_scope _ _%function_scope
prime_dec_gen : forall a b : Z, 1 < b -> b < a -> (forall c : Z, b < c < a -> rel_prime c a) -> prime a \/ ~ prime a
prime_divisors : forall p : Z, prime p -> forall a : Z, (a | p) -> a = -1 \/ a = 1 \/ a = p \/ a = - p
prime_rel_prime : forall p : Z, prime p -> forall a : Z, ~ (p | a) -> rel_prime p a
prime_mult : forall p : Z, prime p -> forall a b : Z, (p | a * b) -> (p | a) \/ (p | b)
square_not_prime : forall a : Z, ~ prime (a * a)
rel_prime_le_prime : forall a p : Z, prime p -> 1 <= a < p -> rel_prime a p
Zis_gcd_unique : forall a b c d : Z, Zis_gcd a b c -> Zis_gcd a b d -> c = d \/ c = - d
Zgcd_is_gcd : forall a b : Z, Zis_gcd a b (Z.gcd a b)
Znumtheory.rel_prime_sym : forall a b : Z, rel_prime a b -> rel_prime b a
Zrel_prime_neq_mod_0 : forall a b : Z, 1 < b -> rel_prime a b -> a mod b <> 0
rel_prime_1 : forall a : Z, rel_prime 1 a
Z.gcd_nonneg : forall a b : Z, 0 <= Z.gcd a b
Z.gcd_divide_r : forall a b : Z, (Z.gcd a b | b)
Z.gcd_divide_l : forall a b : Z, (Z.gcd a b | a)
Zdivide_opp_l_rev : forall a b : Z, (- a | b) -> (a | b)
Zdivide_opp_l : forall a b : Z, (a | b) -> (- a | b)
Zdivide_bounds : forall a b : Z, (a | b) -> b <> 0 -> Z.abs a <= Z.abs b
Gauss : forall a b c : Z, (a | b * c) -> rel_prime a b -> (a | c)
Zis_gcd_intro : forall a b g : Z, (g | a) -> (g | b) -> (forall x : Z, (x | a) -> (x | b) -> (x | g)) -> Zis_gcd a b g
not_prime_divide : forall p : Z, 1 < p -> ~ prime p -> exists n : Z, 1 < n < p /\ (n | p)
ConstructiveRcomplete.Rfloor : forall a : ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal, {p : Z & (ConstructiveCauchyReals.CRealLt (ConstructiveCauchyReals.inject_Q {| QArith_base.Qnum := p; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |}) a * ConstructiveCauchyReals.CRealLt a (ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal_plus (ConstructiveCauchyReals.inject_Q {| QArith_base.Qnum := p; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |}) (ConstructiveCauchyReals.inject_Q {| QArith_base.Qnum := 2; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |})))%type}
BinPosDef.Pos.iter_op = fun (A : Type) (op : A -> A -> A) => fix iter (p : positive) (a : A) {struct p} : A := match p with | (p0~1)%positive => op a (iter p0 (op a a)) | (p0~0)%positive => iter p0 (op a a) | 1%positive => a end : forall A : Type, (A -> A -> A) -> positive -> A -> A Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.iter_op {A}%type_scope _%function_scope _%positive_scope
Zdivide_dec : forall a b : Z, {(a | b)} + {~ (a | b)}
prime_div_prime : forall p q : Z, prime p -> prime q -> (p | q) -> p = q
rel_prime = fun a b : Z => Zis_gcd a b 1 : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments rel_prime (_ _)%Z_scope
not_prime_1 = fun H1 : prime 1 => False_ind False ((fun H : 1 < 1 => let H0 : False := eq_ind (1 ?= 1) (fun e : comparison => match e with | Eq => True | _ => False end) I Lt H in False_ind False H0) (let H : 1 < 1 := match H1 with | prime_intro _ H H0 => (fun (H2 : 1 < 1) (_ : forall n : Z, 1 <= n < 1 -> rel_prime n 1) => H2) H H0 end in H)) : ~ prime 1
BinIntDef.Z.modulo = fun a b : Z => let (_, r) := BinIntDef.Z.div_eucl a b in r : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.modulo (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.gcd = fun a b : Z => match a with | 0 => BinIntDef.Z.abs b | Z.pos a0 | Z.neg a0 => match b with | 0 => BinIntDef.Z.abs a | Z.pos b0 | Z.neg b0 => Z.pos (Pos.gcd a0 b0) end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.gcd (_ _)%Z_scope
prime_alt : forall p : Z, prime' p < -> prime p
sumbool_rec : forall (A B : Prop) (P : {A} + {B} -> Set), (forall a : A, P (left a)) -> (forall b : B, P (right b)) -> forall s : {A} + {B}, P s

```coq
intros a. destruct (Z_lt_dec 1 a) as [H1|].
- destruct (prime_dec_gen a 2 H1 ltac:(lia) ltac:(lia)); auto.
- right. intros H. inversion H. lia.
Qed.
```
